page.title: 15RIBBESFORD WOOD,nr Stourport
page.content: Ribbesford Wood is one mile south of Bewdley.In the wood there are about 330,000 trees most of which are oak.They have recently planted a lot of Corsician pine.About 125 years ago a house was built in the wood called Ribbesford Hall.This has now been demolished and turned into flats for the old people.There are many animals in the wood :-foxes ,badgers ,stoats ,weasels and grey squirrels,but there are no deer. On the Victorian O.S. map there are names such as Church Hill Wood,Walkham Wood ,Trundalls Wood and Castle Hill Wood,but on a new map these names do not appear and they are not used now, except for one name which is still used and that is Botany Bay Coppice. Part of the woods are in the district of Heightington.
